link.title: District Information - COVID-19

div.span: There is a growing concern throughout our state about the spread of the novel coronavirus (COVID-19). We share your concerns and want you to know that the Morgan County R-II School District is closely monitoring updates as guidance is changing frequently due to local and global developments. We are adhering to guidance from the Missouri Department of Health and Senior Services (DHSS), Morgan County Health Department, the Department of Elementary and Secondary Education, and the Centers for Disease Control (CDC). Even though school is currently closed, your students are still our priority. Below, you will find both previous communications sent home with students regarding the school closure, Alternative Methods of Instruction, and lunch pick up, as well as up-to-date communications as they are sent out. These communications are coming from the district administrative office and they will also be posted to our district Facebook page. Some communications will also be sent via auto-dial, email, and text (School Messenger) as well as our School mobile app.

span.span: You will also find resources and information related to Alternative Methods of Instruction (AIM) while school is in closure via the button below. If you have any questions or concerns, please call your student's building and/or our district administrative office. You can also email your student's teacher if you have specific questions regarding assignments or enrichment activities.

a.class: u_1103065188 align-center dmButtonLink dmWidget dmWwr default dmOnlyButton dmDefaultGradient
a.span: Alternative Methods of Instruction - Resources PK-12

span.a: Meal Service Plan for the Morgan County R-II School District - April 6th - April 24th - 4.1.2020

font.a: Statement on Behalf of the Morgan County R-1 & R-2 School District and Health Department 3.30.2020

div.span: Letters Set Home With Students Prior to Closure:

You do not need to leave your car. You do not need to bring your students. Food pick-up time extended 10 a.m. to 1 p.m. in all locations. This is FREE for all students PK-12 and available on each day school was to be in session. (see updates below).

span.font: Location 3 - United Methodist Church in Laurie, Missouri (Hwy. 5)

li.span: Guidance has changed regarding students being present. The student does NOT have to be present for the parent/guardian to pick up the meals. (9:30 a.m.)

We are going to now extend food pick up from 10am - 1 pm from now on. Yes, we are still serving meals tomorrow. We will also hand out two days worth each day from this day forward, 4 meals total to each student. Each meal needs to be counted, so each student will be 4 meals on the tally sheets if they take all 4. Any questions, please call the district administrative office at (573)378-4231. We also have volunteers from our local ministerial alliance in all three communities that are volunteering as well as our staff members. Thank you to Tracy Lepley Thank you to everyone for volunteering and thank you to everyone for their patience and support during this time. (12:45 p.m.)
